content_en:
This is the short film along with my original instrumental music â€œIndigo moonâ€.
The storyfeatures a girl suffering from insomnia because of some lingering regrets and her way of overcoming the days through dreaming.
It is inspired by Japanese Folk Tales The Tale of Princess Kaguya.

ã€ŠStaffã€‹
Music, Director: Ayaka Yabuki
Cinematographer: Kanon Fukuma, Nodoka Matsumura
Assistant Director: Mana Hashimoto, Mariko Soga
Lighting Director: Hiroki Niikura
Lighting Assistant: Kaho Miyake, Shiori Saito
Stylist: Hitomi Yamashita,Kanon Fukuma
Art Designer: Nanami Kanno, Haruki Manabe, Hiroka Kimishima
Staff:Yurika Noguchi, Kei Saito,KanameShiuchi, Ryuichi Yamazaki, Koushirou Oribe, Tomoya Ishii, Hikari Teshigawara, Natsuki Toyosaki

* YouTube video quality may be reduced depending on your internet connection.
If thishappens, please adjust the video quality in Settings > Video Quality to enjoy the video better.

ã‚­ãƒãƒ  HP ã‚ˆã‚Šã”äºˆç´„å—ä»˜ä¸­ï¼

æœ¬â¼ˆã‚³ãƒ¡ãƒ³ãƒˆï¼š

Iâ€™m very happy to be performing at Kichimu for the first time. At the same time, Iâ€™m feeling a little nervousâ€¦ (laughs)

I often find myself wrapped in ambivalent emotionsâ€”finding sadness within joy, joy within sadnessâ€”and living each day surrounded by a variety of colors. Perhaps many different colors are moving through your hearts as well.

For this performance, Iâ€™d like to create a live show that positively celebrates the various colors that come into our hearts, like the seasons as they pass through us in that moment.

Iâ€™d be very happy if you could come and enjoy the time together.

ï¼ˆAyaka Yabukiï¼‰
